ai-tika-s0404t12:2_1: Udāyī, there are five senior mendicants named Udāyī.
ai-tika-s0404t12:2_2: Its heat, hunger, and thirst, the ultimate binding.
ai-tika-s0404t12:2_3: He has disposed of unconditioned and the hindrances are absent.
ai-tika-s0404t12:2_4: Therefore there is a name named Dhanañjāni.
ai-tika-s0404t12:2_5: For a hindrance, he calls a hindrance, and he has spoken of.
ai-tika-s0404t12:2_6: mattresses stuffed, best of food, the foremost, best, chief, highest, and finest.
ai-tika-s0404t12:2_7: who has been given up as a human being is said to be trapped in the net.
ai-tika-s0404t12:2_8: ‘But how has a mendicant drawn back his eyes?’
ai-tika-s0404t12:2_9: It’s when a mendicant has given up the conceit ‘I am’, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.
ai-tika-s0404t12:2_10: That is just all the more.
ai-tika-s0404t12:4_0: So there are mansions for the Nuns
ai-tika-s0404t12:5_0: The Book of the Nines and given up.
ai-tika-s0404t12:6_0: Homage to that Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!
